title: QA Basics: A Talk for Devs, Project Managers & Presidents on Why & When They Need QA
description: I did an "Intro to QA" talk for BTVWAG about a year ago that went over very well. I'd like to rework the material a little to use for Vermont Code Camp. It covers QA basics; defining QA, when & why it is needed as part of the SDLC, a few quick QA exercises for the audience (QA a coffee mug), some basic QA vocabulary, automated vs manual testing why and when to use them, the benefits of using QA, and does it really cut costs?
